title: Fragile Items Handling
content: Fragile items should be handled with care using padded grippers.
Fragile items should not be stacked more than two high.
Inspect fragile packages visually before moving them.
Avoid sudden movements or dropping fragile items.
Use slow, steady motions when transporting fragile objects.

title: Heavy Boxes Handling
content: Heavy boxes must be lifted with forklift arms, not robot grippers.
Heavy boxes require the robot arm to move slowly to maintain balance.
Always ensure the path is clear before moving heavy boxes.
Check the maximum load capacity of the robot gripper.
Do not attempt to lift more than the recommended weight.

title: Hazardous Materials Safety
content: Hazardous materials require gloves and sensors to avoid spills.
Check safety locks before moving hazardous packages.
Ensure proper ventilation in areas storing hazardous items.
Follow all emergency procedures in case of leakage.
Keep flammable materials away from heat sources.

title: Equipment Specifications
content: Maximum gripper weight capacity is 10kg.
Forklift arm maximum lift height is 2 meters.
Conveyor belt speed should not exceed 1 m/s.
Robot sensors should be calibrated every week.
Battery levels should be checked before starting operations.

title: Troubleshooting Guides
content: If the robot fails to pick an object, check the gripper alignment.
If sensors fail to detect objects, clean the sensor lenses.
Restart the robot if it freezes during operation.
Check battery level if the robot stops moving unexpectedly.
Recalibrate sensors if readings are inconsistent.

title: Pallets and Stacking
content: Pallets should be aligned properly to avoid tipping during movement.
Do not stack pallets higher than 2 meters.
Ensure all boxes on the pallet are stable before transport.
Check forklift alignment before lifting pallets.
Secure loose items on pallets with straps if needed.

title: Conveyor Operations
content: Conveyor belts should run at a maximum speed of 1 m/s.
Do not overload conveyor belts beyond their capacity.
Inspect belt rollers for wear regularly.
Keep hands and tools away from moving belts.
Stop the conveyor before performing maintenance.

title: Barcode Scanning
content: Ensure barcode scanners are clean to avoid misreading package IDs.
Scan each package individually for accuracy.
If a barcode is damaged, manually enter the code.
Check scanner calibration weekly.
Avoid scanning packages in low light conditions.

title: Safety Checks Before Operations
content: Perform a visual inspection of the robot and workspace before operation.
Ensure emergency stop buttons are accessible.
Check all sensors for proper functionality.
Verify gripper and arm mechanisms are secure.
Confirm path is free from obstacles or humans.

title: Flammable Materials Handling
content: Store flammable materials in designated safe areas.
Keep flammable items away from heat sources.
Use non-sparking tools when handling flammable items.
Ensure proper ventilation in areas storing flammable materials.
Follow emergency procedures in case of fire.
